properties.description: Roger I conquers Malta.
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.description: Amalfi submits to Roger II in the summer or fall of 1087.
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.description: Salerno submits to Roger II in the summer or fall of 1127.
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.short description: Capture of Otranto Occurs by This Time
properties.description: The citizens of Otranto handed over their city to Roger II after witnessing the defeat of Torre Umfredo and Taranto.
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.short description: Capture of Oria Occurs by This Date
properties.description: Oria is attacked and taken by Roger II directly after the siege of Castro.
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.description: Roger II recaptured Melfi and "the other ducal towns" before returning to Salerno.
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.description: Tancred retakes the city of Brindisi during Roger II's absence.
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.description: Roger II comes upon Castro, retaken by Tancred, and destroys it.
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.description: Roger II attacks and takes Ruvo.
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.description: Roger II took Salfi while moving towards Troia.
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.description: Grand Emir George attacked Li Galli while blockading the Amalfitans.
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.description: Grand Emir George attacked Capri while blockading the Amalfitans.
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.short description: Tancred of Conversano Raised an Army at Montepeloso
properties.description: Feeling emboldended by Roger II's defeat at Nocera, Tancred of Conversano brought together an army at the city of Montepeloso to recover his lands.
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.description: After the siege and sacking, Montepeloso was destroyed.
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.short description: Capture of Bisceglie Occurs This Year
properties.description: Roger II captures the coastal city of Bisceglie and destroys its fortifications.
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.short description: Roger II Called his Army to Meet at Apice
properties.description: Roger II tells his men to meet him at Apice to begin the campaigning season
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.description: Roger II came to Prata and razed the city.
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.description: Roger II avoided Benevento and instead laid waste to Palma, a city belonging to Annonius.
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.description: Roger II captured the tower Scafati and destroyed the wooden bridge there, preventing the army of Terra di Lavoro from crossing to attack him.
properties.people:
Roger II, King
Rainulf II, Count of Caiazzo and Alife
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.short description: Roger II Destroys City of Limata
properties.description: Roger II came to Limata on the same day as taking Ponte.  It was sacked and razed.
properties.people:
Roger II, King
Radulf de Bernia, Baron
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.short description: Count Rainulf Attempted to Take Back Capua
properties.description: In 1135, Count Rainulf, thinking Roger II had died, tried and failed to win back Capua.  He plundered their fields before departing.
properties.people: Rainulf II, Count of Caiazzo and Alife
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.short description: Sacking of Amalfi in 1135 by Pisan Forces
properties.description: Under the pay of Robert II, new Pisan troops laid waste to Amalfi while its defenders were absent.
properties.people: Robert II, Prince of the Capuans
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.description: Atrani was captured by forces loyal to Robert II.
properties.people: Robert II, Prince of the Capuans
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.description: Once Amalfi was raided, the coastal town of Scala was next attacked.
properties.people: Robert II, Prince of the Capuans
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.description: The Pisan forces attacked the fortress of Fratte near Ravello.
properties.people: Robert II, Prince of the Capuans
properties.source:
The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).
Skinner, Patricia.  Medieval Amalfi and its Diaspora, 800-1250 (Oxford University Press, 2013)

properties.short description: Destruction of the Vines of Naples
properties.description: Roger II returned to Naples and destroyed its vines.
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.description: Adam Avenel began to raid and ransack Naples' territory.  Some knights blockaded Naples by sea.
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.short description: Second Appointed Defense of Terra di Lavoro
properties.description: Taking over for Adam Avenel came Count Adam son of Richard.
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).
